### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #18349 (build: Fix quick hack for version string in releases by hebasto)

If you consider this pull request important, p

Meta question: could we described the "users" of bootstrapped files? What systems they are use? What are their workflows? etc.\n\nI suppose a user of the Bitcoin Core, who is willing to build his binaries from sources, runs a non-unusual Linux distro, and is able to start build with `./autogen.sh`. If we assume that non-unusual system has `pkg-config` installed, why we couldn't make the same ass

In my mind, including bootstrapped files (and effectively pinning the autotools version) is better than not including them. Why would we not also include bootstrapped files if it's easy to do?

![0fc](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3445290/78055403-77f03e80-7351-11ea-9a04-c83073e1a42e.gif)
Concept ACK. Travis out-of-tree builds are failing.

> Why would we not also include bootstrapped files if it's easy to do?

I don't care about this very much, but will answer the question.

Advantages of including bootstrapped files:

- Person building from source no longer has to install autotools and m4, just a c++ compiler, linker, and gnu make.

Disadvantages of including bootstrapped files:

- Adds to differences between ta

### Gitian builds | File | commit 965c0c37d54c727bee50920fdfa62f8174a94280
(master) | commit 81df43f232237a11c9cb4bf9b4c0418066313d2f
(master and this pull) | |--|--|--| | bitcoin-0.19.99-aarch64-linux-gnu-debug.tar.gz | [`57aab7e587f3ea0a...`](https://drahtbot.space/gitian/bitcoin/bitcoin/965c0c37d54c727bee50920fdfa62f8174a94280/bitcoin-0.19.99-
I personally prefer using `git archive` here. It's nice and simple and straightforward.\n\nCalling `git ls-files` in the makefile is imo a bit strange, given tarballs etc *don't* build from git.

Noted, closing.

Followups:
- We might need the `no-dist` automake option, as I don't think `make dist` makes sense anymore
- We should clean up `dist` related targets in `Makefile.am`
`make dist` should be used by gitian.\n\n`git archive` would omit important files (like `configure`!).
